item.title: Income Tax Brackets
item.description: Contents: Income tax brackets are one of those financial systems that many people understand on the surface: a set of brackets (or ranges) that coincide with different levels of income that are used by governments to collect the appropriate amount of taxes from individuals. Theyâ€™re also one of the systems that frequently get misunderstood: making enough additional money will cause you to move up into the next tax bracket and cost you more in taxes on that money than the amount of money itself.
